dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b McLaren 99 (110b 13x4 0x6 173m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'im, no century for Dilshan, it was a slower ball that tailed in towards the stumps, it was full and heading for middle, Dilshan looking to drive to the on-side, he doesn't cover for the movement and that crashes into middle, a rare moment of joy for South Africa

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara not out 75 (45b 12x4 0x6 76m) SR: 166.66

dismissalComment.html: straight to Miller at long-off. It was a full delivery outside off and Mathews makes room to swing his arms but he hands a simple catch to David Miller at the boundary

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c †de Kock b Morkel 9 (16b 2x4 0x6 19m) SR: 56.25

dismissalComment.html: Morkel gets the first wicket, shortish ball outside off, Perera goes for the pull, bottom-edges it through to the keeper, big appeal and the umpire doesn't need much convincing, another single-digit score for Kusal, big disappointment for a whole bunch of our readers

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Duminy b Phangiso 68 (93b 6x4 1x6 126m) SR: 73.11

dismissalComment.html: superb catch from JP Duminy, SA were looking for a bit of magic to get the wicket, Duminy provides it, a terrific-looking lofted driven from Thirimanne, again not full power on it, Duminy has to move towards the boundary to get under that, he keeps his eyes on the ball and connects that well, tumbles over after taking that catch, but he makes sure the ball remains in his palm, end of a solid innings from Thirimanne

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Mathews b Mendis 51 (51b 5x4 1x6 85m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: And he gets a wicket off his first ball. He makes a little room for himself and heaves the ball into the off side off the front foot, but he neither gets the elevation, nor had he placed it well. Goes straight to point who takes a simple catch

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan McLaren c Mathews b Mendis 29 (73b 2x4 0x6 84m) SR: 39.72

dismissalComment.html: Mendis strikes again, McLaren's vigil is over, Mendis came round the wicket this time, a slower one with plenty of flight, a top edge from McLaren as he looks to chop that, on to the keeper's pads and loops up for first slip, Mendis has three

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: the end of Behardien, will it be the end of his international career for a while? utterly uncomfortable in the middle, looking to slog that to the leg side, hit high on the bat and it loops to give mid-off a simple catch, 1 off 22 balls is truly awful

oh dear, there goes Miller as well, what a shambolic performance this is turning out to be, a nick through to the keeper, once again the batsman doesn't move his feet and chases the ball, easy for Sangakkara, AB watches helplessly from the other end

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: it's all over, Lakmal aims for the top of off and gets it through the defences of Tsotsobe, who seems surprised that is sneaked through

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And he gets a wicket off his first ball. He makes a little room for himself and heaves the ball into the off side off the front foot, but he neither gets the elevation, nor had he placed it well. Goes straight to point who takes a simple catch
He's gone. Mendis proves too good for the No. 9. Googly from Mendis defeats Morkel's defensive prod and hits the stumps. Its drinks

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mendis strikes again, McLaren's vigil is over, Mendis came round the wicket this time, a slower one with plenty of flight, a top edge from McLaren as he looks to chop that, on to the keeper's pads and loops up for first slip, Mendis has three

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Senanayake 27 (21b 5x4 0x6 23m) SR: 128.57

dismissalComment.html: He's gone. His stumps are broken the first ball he faces against the spinner. This one turns into the left hander, but de Kock playing for the ball turning away from him cant bring his defensive bat in line with the ball and he's clean bowled

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Senanayake 18 (28b 2x4 0x6 40m) SR: 64.28

dismissalComment.html: Another one for Sennanayake. And its the big one. Amla misreads the one that goes the other way and is trapped in front of the stumps. He moves back to turn the ball to leg, tries to correct his shot and plays straight but still misses it and is struck on the pads.

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Dilshan 15 (14b 3x4 0x6 21m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: Goes back again and is caught plumb in front. Dlishan is absolutely elated, skipping about and waving his arms with a big smile on his face. It is a length ball to which he goes back and Duminy tries to defend it but misses completely

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c †Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 6 (13b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 46.15

dismissalComment.html: Perera's uncanny ability to take wickets is on show again, just his second ball, it is outside off, du Plessis looks to carve it through the off side, he can only nick it through to the keeper, another poor day for Faf, no footwork at all from Faf, very loose as he played outside off

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lonwabo Tsotsobe b Lakmal 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 14.28

commentTextItems.html: it's all over, Lakmal aims for the top of off and gets it through the defences of Tsotsobe, who seems surprised that is sneaked through

commentPostTextItems.html: A dominant performance from Sri Lanka, sweeping aside South Africa today despite bringing in a host of understudies. Caps a terrific series for them, and leaves South Africa with plenty of homework to do.
Stats man extraordinnaire Mohandas Menon tweets: This 4-1 defeat is South Africa's worst ODI series performance since its 4-0 loss in England (Natwest Series) in August 2008.
Uwaisul Karnain: "The only favor done by the top order players of South Africa for their tailenders is that they have preserved their review."

indika chathuranga: "As a srilanakan fan who loves watching SA team playing since the childhood, i'm thoroughly dissapointed with their performance in this series. Hope they will put up a good fight in T20s against the worlds no1 T20 team. Best of luck.."
James: "South Africa have "plenty of homework to do"? Have they re-engaged Mickey Arthur?" A few more series like this, and Mickey will be back in charge of SA.

The Man of the Match is Tillakaratne Dilshan: "I think McLaren bowled that over really well. Little bit disappointed but these kind of things happen. I'm really enjoying, when I get a start I want to make a big one. Really good series for me, bowled well, batted well, fielded well."

Man of the Series is Kumar Sangakkara: "We had thir batting at 3, he and Dilshan gave us the platform, it was my job to push the scoring. I haven't changed my game a lot, I try to play situations well, I try to target bowlers, when you play in Sri Lanka you need totals above 260. My first series was a triangular against SA, they are the best side in Test cricket, they've always done well against us. I've enjoyed watching guys like AB and Hash."

AB de Villiers: "Looked like we played cricket out of our league, unfortunately couldn't get some momentum going. We'll keep learning. It's amazing when you start to lose all these negatives kick up and you start to overanalyse things. It was a great experience, played some quality spin and against a subcontinent team that really know their conditions very well."

Angelo Mathews: "Couldn't have asked for any better, I thought Dilshan and Thirimanne batted brilliantly, unfortunately Dilshan couldn't get to his century. We have got a good blend of seniors and juniors, pretty happy with the way they performed. On behalf of the national team, I'd like to thank the fans for their support."

Mathews holds aloft the series trophy, and his team-mates join in soon after.  As Sri Lanka bask in the glow of victory, we'll bring our ball-by-ball coverage to a close. There's plenty more on the series coming up, including features and analysis from Andrew Fernando.
All you angry SA fans, it's not the end of the world. Thanks for all the mails, see you at during the T20 series.

commentTextItems.html: Lakmal angles this down the leg side, looking to glance that towards fine leg, off the pads to the boundary
short of length and on off stump, 133kph, blocked to the off side
shortish ball angling in, Tsotsobe ducks under, umpire signals that's the first bouncer of the over

commentPreTextItems.html: Priyal: "Oh! these two party spoilers are delaying Sri Lanka's celebrations! Must be annoying for Mathews and clan!"

commentTextItems.html: slides that in towards middle and leg, pitched up, defended off the front foot to the off side
a flighted googly turns towards middle, a thick inside edge sends the ball towards square leg

commentTextItems.html: length ball on off stump, solid forward defensive from Tsotsobe
massive turn there for Mendis, did it hit some sort of crack? it stays very low and turns way down the leg side

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan McLaren c Mathews b Mendis 29 (73b 2x4 0x6 84m) SR: 39.72

commentTextItems.html: Mendis strikes again, McLaren's vigil is over, Mendis came round the wicket this time, a slower one with plenty of flight, a top edge from McLaren as he looks to chop that, on to the keeper's pads and loops up for first slip, Mendis has three

commentPostTextItems.html: Kim Hackney: "Graeme Smith now we all note the value he brings to South Africa cricket as captain, ABDV is a great palyer and needs to concentrate on batting and fielding."

commentTextItems.html: skips down the track and clips it towards deep square leg
again safely negotiated off the back foot
pitching in middle and leg and spinning in towards McLaren, defended off the back foot
goes back again and punches it to the right of point this time for a single

commentTextItems.html: tries the sweep, but it turns too much. beats the bat
Goes back and cuts this straight to point
both these batsmen are driving well. this one is on leg stump, but he makes room and punches it through the covers and the long-off can't cut this off

dismissalComment.html: Morkel gets the first wicket, shortish ball outside off, Perera goes for the pull, bottom-edges it through to the keeper, big appeal and the umpire doesn't need much convincing, another single-digit score for Kusal, big disappointment for a whole bunch of our readers

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Duminy b Phangiso 68 (93b 6x4 1x6 126m) SR: 73.11

dismissalComment.html: superb catch from JP Duminy, SA were looking for a bit of magic to get the wicket, Duminy provides it, a terrific-looking lofted driven from Thirimanne, again not full power on it, Duminy has to move towards the boundary to get under that, he keeps his eyes on the ball and connects that well, tumbles over after taking that catch, but he makes sure the ball remains in his palm, end of a solid innings from Thirimanne

dismissalComment.html: straight to Miller at long-off. It was a full delivery outside off and Mathews makes room to swing his arms but he hands a simple catch to David Miller at the boundary

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Senanayake 27 (21b 5x4 0x6 23m) SR: 128.57

dismissalComment.html: He's gone. His stumps are broken the first ball he faces against the spinner. This one turns into the left hander, but de Kock playing for the ball turning away from him cant bring his defensive bat in line with the ball and he's clean bowled

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Senanayake 18 (28b 2x4 0x6 40m) SR: 64.28

dismissalComment.html: Another one for Sennanayake. And its the big one. Amla misreads the one that goes the other way and is trapped in front of the stumps. He moves back to turn the ball to leg, tries to correct his shot and plays straight but still misses it and is struck on the pads.

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Dilshan 15 (14b 3x4 0x6 21m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: Goes back again and is caught plumb in front. Dlishan is absolutely elated, skipping about and waving his arms with a big smile on his face. It is a length ball to which he goes back and Duminy tries to defend it but misses completely

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c †Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 6 (13b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 46.15

dismissalComment.html: Perera's uncanny ability to take wickets is on show again, just his second ball, it is outside off, du Plessis looks to carve it through the off side, he can only nick it through to the keeper, another poor day for Faf, no footwork at all from Faf, very loose as he played outside off

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Mathews b Mendis 51 (51b 5x4 1x6 85m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: And he gets a wicket off his first ball. He makes a little room for himself and heaves the ball into the off side off the front foot, but he neither gets the elevation, nor had he placed it well. Goes straight to point who takes a simple catch

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Mathews b Lakmal 1 (22b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 4.54

dismissalComment.html: the end of Behardien, will it be the end of his international career for a while? utterly uncomfortable in the middle, looking to slog that to the leg side, hit high on the bat and it loops to give mid-off a simple catch, 1 off 22 balls is truly awful

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c †Sangakkara b Lakmal 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh dear, there goes Miller as well, what a shambolic performance this is turning out to be, a nick through to the keeper, once again the batsman doesn't move his feet and chases the ball, easy for Sangakkara, AB watches helplessly from the other end

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan McLaren c Mathews b Mendis 29 (73b 2x4 0x6 84m) SR: 39.72

dismissalComment.html: Mendis strikes again, McLaren's vigil is over, Mendis came round the wicket this time, a slower one with plenty of flight, a top edge from McLaren as he looks to chop that, on to the keeper's pads and loops up for first slip, Mendis has three

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel b Mendis 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: He's gone. Mendis proves too good for the No. 9. Googly from Mendis defeats Morkel's defensive prod and hits the stumps. Its drinks

dismissalText.commentary: Aaron Phangiso not out 18 (28b 3x4 0x6 35m) SR: 64.28

dismissalComment.html: it's all over, Lakmal aims for the top of off and gets it through the defences of Tsotsobe, who seems surprised that is sneaked through

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 39 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 12.1 overs (73 balls), Extras 4
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 59/1 in 16.0 overs (TM Dilshan 27, HDRL Thirimanne 19)
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 76 balls (TM Dilshan 28, HDRL Thirimanne 20, Ex 2)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 23.2 overs (140 balls), Extras 6
TM Dilshan: 50 off 64 balls (7 x 4)
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 126 balls (TM Dilshan 51, HDRL Thirimanne 46, Ex 4)
HDRL Thirimanne: 50 off 73 balls (3 x 4, 1 x 6)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 30.5 overs (185 balls), Extras 11
2nd Wicket: 150 runs in 166 balls (TM Dilshan 78, HDRL Thirimanne 63, Ex 9)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 170/1 in 33.0 overs (TM Dilshan 86, HDRL Thirimanne 64)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 37 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 37.3 overs (225 balls), Extras 13
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 43.3 overs (261 balls), Extras 13
KC Sangakkara: 50 off 33 balls (8 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 300 runs in 49.4 overs (298 balls), Extras 15
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 307/4 in 50.0 overs (KC Sangakkara 75, NLTC Perera 17)
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 28 balls (KC Sangakkara 30, NLTC Perera 17, Ex 3)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 60 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 50 runs in 8.3 overs (51 balls), Extras 0
Drinks: South Africa - 82/4 in 18.0 overs (AB de Villiers 13, F Behardien 1)
South Africa: 100 runs in 24.4 overs (148 balls), Extras 5
Over 24.6: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - RR Wimalasiri, Batsman - R McLaren (Struck down)
AB de Villiers: 50 off 49 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
7th Wicket: 50 runs in 67 balls (AB de Villiers 35, R McLaren 13, Ex 2)
Powerplay 2: Overs 32.1 - 37.0 (Batting side - 6 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 150 runs in 39.1 overs (235 balls), Extras 5

milestones.description: Sangakkara has scored 92 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record

stories.title: Thirimanne's calm approach bodes well for SL
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Lahiru Thirimanne's calm approach bodes well for SL
stories.summary: Lahiru Thirimanne's innings in the fifth ODI was not very different from some of the other innings he has played before, but his calculated approach to run-making left an impression

image.caption: Lahiru Thirimanne punches one through the off side
image.longCaption: Lahiru Thirimanne punches one through the off side, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo, July 31, 2013

stories.title: South Africa turn to introspection after thrashing
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: South Africa turn to introspection after thrashing
stories.summary: AB de Villiers had marked out the ODIs in Sri Lanka as the beginning of South Africa's approach to the 2015 World Cup, but South Africa's captain conceded, after the fifth ODI in Colombo, that the 4-1 thrashing may trigger changes in personnel

image.caption: AB de Villiers reacts after attempting to stop the ball
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers reacts after attempting to stop the ball, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 20, 2013

stories.title: Much work needed on several fronts for South Africa
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Much work needed on several fronts for South Africa
stories.summary: The opening combination, the spinner's spot, the pace bowing in less helpful conditions, the wicketkeeping, the captaincy … there was little that went right for South Africa in Sri Lanka

image.caption: AB de Villers sighs as Kumar Sangakkara hits a four
image.longCaption: AB de Villers sighs as Kumar Sangakkara hits a four, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo, July 31, 2013

stories.title: Dilshan's skip and anti-climax
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
stories.summary: Plays of the Day from the fifth ODI between Sri Lanka and South Africa in Colombo

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was bowled on 99
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was bowled on 99, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo, July 31, 2013

stories.title: Dominant Sri Lanka make it 4-1
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
stories.summary: South Africa suffered a fifth successive sub-standard batting performance in Sri Lanka to concede the final match in the series - a dead rubber - to opposition who have shown their superiority

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan looks to the heavens after his fifty
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan looks to the heavens after his fifty, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo, July 31, 2013

stories.title: 'Situation allows us to free up a bit' - de Villiers
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: 'Situation allows us to free up a bit' - AB de Villiers
stories.summary: With South Africa missing the services of Dale Steyn, Graeme Smith and Jacques Kallis, a 3-2 series loss to Sri Lanka would not be such a bad result, especially with the inexperience in the squad

image.caption: AB de Villiers is pensive after yet another loss in Sri Lanka
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers is pensive after yet another loss in Sri Lanka, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele, July 28, 2013

stories.title: Chance for youngsters to shine
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
stories.summary: Wednesday's encounter could shape to be another meaningless dead rubber in a series already short on context, but Sri Lanka's selectors have stepped in to ratchet up interest, if only among the host nation's fans
stories.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Kusal Perera blasts one through the off side
image.longCaption: Kusal Perera blasts one through the off side, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Hambantota, March 23, 2013

videos.title: 'Negatives are popping up everywhere' - de Villiers
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: 'Negatives are popping up everywhere' - de Villiers
videos.summary: South Africa ODI captain AB de Villiers found it difficult to find any positives from his side's 4-1 series defeat to Sri Lanka that culminated with a 128-run loss on Wednesday

galleries.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 5th ODI, Colombo
